bibl.title: Apokrimata, Decreta, and the Roman Legal Procedure.
bibl.note: An apokrima was an emperor's decretum, an oral decision, given in open court, after the emperor had listened to litigants presenting their case. It had nothing to do with petitions and their subscriptions. That fact affects our picture of each of the procedures involved.
bibl.seg: Turpin William, Apokrimata, Decreta, and the Roman Legal Procedure.
